intro: Scleria onoei, commonly known as the Japanese spike rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and other grass-like plants. The plant has slender, triangular stems and produces small, spike-like clusters of flowers. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often growing in dense, compact clusters. Scleria onoei is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or wetlands.
